title: Build A GoHighLevel Marketplace App in 20 Minutes Or Less! (Updated 2026)
author: BetterBots
transcript: Hey, welcome to today's training on how to build a go highle marketplace app. I'm Quinton and today we're going to be walking through how to set up ooth 2 in a go highle marketplace app so that you can start selling your app to everybody that uses go highle or you can simply use it as an upgrade for your users. Now for the prerequisite for today, we have a few things we're going to need to set up. So that is the complete flow from OOTH 2.0 beginning to end. You just did it. Congratulations. This is exactly how every app in the marketplace works. Uh and then you should be able to see in the get request with that new token, you now have a 200 response. Um, now this is the whole flow and I just want to make sure that everybody watching understands that access tokens do expire every 24 hours. That is one of the major points of OOTH 2 is that the tokens are short-lived tokens. And so that way if one happens to get leaked somehow, it's only got a finite life experience and they can be um rotated and revoked at any point just by issuing a new token. So whenever you create one set of tokens, the last set automatically invalidates. But in your production environment, you are going to need to make sure that you either have a timer that is just going every 23 hours looking up your tokens and and exchanging them using the refresh token. So the only difference is that in the grant type, instead of setting code or authorization code, you would just set refresh token and then instead of setting code as the parameter that you send, you send refresh token. Um, and that will make it so that you can get a brand new set of access and refresh tokens. Uh, and then you can forever authenticate as long as that person does not change their password or manually uninstall the app. So, I hope this all makes sense.
